body.div:
Jolokia is remote JMX with JSON over HTTP.
It is fast, simple, polyglot and adds unique features. It's JMX on Capsaicin.
body.p: Jolokia is a JMX-HTTP bridge giving an alternative to JSR-160 connectors. It is an agent based approach with support for many platforms. In addition to basic JMX operations it enhances JMX remoting with unique features like bulk requests or fine grained security policies. Have a look yourself at these features.

ul.li: Overview of Features which make Jolokia unique for JMX remoting.
The Documentation includes a tutorial, a reference manual and the JSON protocol specification.
Agents are available for many platforms (JEE, OSGi, Mule, JDK6 JVM).
Client libraries include language bindings for Java and Perl.

subsection.name: Alpha version of www.jolokia.org deployed
subsection.p: Well, it's really more work than expected, but setting up a proper web site and making a release is really, really much work. I wanted to have it ready right now, but its not yet finished (e.g. I'm still waiting on some icons). Nevertheless, it's still more than a skeleton, so I push it out now (without big announcement yet). Of course, final touches will hapen until november as well as a regular (== non-snapshot) release.
Release soon, release often. That's what they told me.

subsection.name: Jolokia 0.80-SNAPSHOT
subsection.p: The current snapshot release 0.80-SNAPSHOT which you can find on the Download page and on out maven repository is identical to the agent part of jmx4perl 0.72 feature- and codewise. So it is quite usable ;-).
